document_data.name: Shelaya
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite organized play/LC/The Good, the Undead, and the Ugly|10}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Shelaya''' was a [[bard]] who performed at the [[Golden Goblet Inn]] in [[Mossbridges]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: Shelaya was a petite [[human]] woman with a head of flaming-red hair, green eyes, and a pleasant smile.
document_data.Relationships: She was familiar with a good [[half-orc]] [[fighter]] who occasionally visited the Goblet – he retired fighter, [[Chester Hearth]]. Shelaya knew of a way to get to the orc's hut and was aware of Chester's old master – the [[priest]] named [[Athoomb]].
document_data.History: When a new popular inn opened in Mossbridges in the late 14{{th}} century DR, the Golden Goblet Inn became Shelaya's employer. She would often be found at the inn, plucking her [[mandolin]] and performing various songs, melodies, and tales.
